text: He called a goat to his goats to take them to the stable. One of them stopped by a rich pasture. The goat threw a stone at him, but with such bad luck he broke his horn. And the goat begged the goat not to tell the master; and the goat said, I would have kept my mouth shut, but I could not. Of course you can see my broken horn! Never deny the obvious.
title: La cabra y el cabrero
author: nan Esopo
